answers.answer: Hi, most probably it is meralgia paraesthetica which involves lesion of lateral cutaneous nerve of thigh. This may be due to nerve entrapment by abnormal structures or seen in diabetes. Pressure may also be caused by long periods of standing which increase tension on the inguinal ligament.Treatment involves rest, hot compressions, pain killers, nerve block injections and surgery to decompress nerve.Please visit website for more information http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meralgia_paraesthetica

question: I work on my feet most of the day I find that after a few hours the top of my right thigh becomes numb and begins to burn.  Any ideas.
title: pins and needles
